main event: A radar sighting of an unidentified aerial object occurred on 1 November 1948, reported by personnel at Goose Bay, Labrador.
interesting points: The object was bright yellow and traveled 4 miles in approximately 4 minutes and 7 seconds, suggesting a speed of around 60 MPH., The object was initially tracked at around 3 3/4 miles from the station, before disappearing from radar., Observations hinted that the object was not large enough to be an aircraft and too large to be a bird., The object appeared to move in a straight line and did not exhibit evasive maneuvers., The object disappeared at a bearing of 182 degrees from the station.
witness description: M/Sgt Francis E. Mills, GCA Operator at Goose Bay.
